pullRequest.body:
Properties of left and right derivatives of a convex function on (the interior of) a convex set: monotonicity; leftDeriv <= rightDeriv; if leftDeriv <= 0 <= rightDeriv then the function is minimal.

From the TestingLowerBounds project.
Co-authored-by: Lorenzo Luccioli

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [247f7f79a1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21063/commits/247f7f79a13ae113f29960fba4329fe866db53de)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ConcaveOn.antitoneOn_slope_gt`
`+ ConcaveOn.antitoneOn_slope_lt`
`+ ConvexOn.monotoneOn_slope_gt`
`+ ConvexOn.monotoneOn_slope_lt`
`+ MonotoneOn.csInf_eq_of_subset_of_forall_exists_le`
`+ MonotoneOn.csSup_eq_of_subset_of_forall_exists_le`
`+ bddAbove_slope_gt_of_mem_interior`
`+ bddBelow_slope_lt_of_mem_interior`
`+ differentiableWithinAt_Iio_of_mem_interior`
`+ differentiableWithinAt_Ioi_of_mem_interior`
`+ hasDerivWithinAt_leftDeriv_of_mem_interior`
`+ hasDerivWithinAt_rightDeriv_of_mem_interior`
`+ hasDerivWithinAt_sInf_slope_of_mem_interior`
`+ hasDerivWithinAt_sSup_slope_of_mem_interior`
`+ isMinOn_of_leftDeriv_eq_zero`
`+ isMinOn_of_leftDeriv_nonpos_of_rightDeriv_nonneg`
`+ isMinOn_of_rightDeriv_eq_zero`
`+ leftDeriv_eq_sSup_slope_of_mem_interior`
`+ leftDeriv_le_rightDeriv_of_mem_interior`
`+ monotoneOn_leftDeriv`
`+ monotoneOn_rightDeriv`
`+ rightDeriv_eq_sInf_slope_of_mem_interior`
`+ rightDeriv_le_slope_of_mem_interior`
`+ slope_le_leftDeriv_of_mem_interior`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Your suggested replacements look much more brittle than the simp calls. What's your motivation for avoiding simp?

> Your suggested replacements look much more brittle than the simp calls. What's your motivation for avoiding simp?

I just want to remove raw `simp` if possible. Of course, `simp only` will also do the job, and I don't mind if those are rewritten using `simp only`.
Why do you want to remove raw `simp`?
There are no good reasons, to be honest. Still, I think by getting rid of raw `simp`s in the first place will reduce the build time, at least a bit. (this might not be true in general)

There are many things that go into the speed of a proof. Here are the three main ones:
* tactic runtime
* term elaboration time
* kernel checking time

Replacing tactics by the terms they produce makes the first one decrease but might significantly increase the second one. Elaboration is complicated.

Besides the dubious time gain, removing tactics also means your proof is less flexible and more sensible to future changes to the library. A small performance gain on an automated task might turn into a huge time sink on a manual one.

TLDR: Don't remove simp!! 🙂

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21076~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Removing unnecessary `simp`s.
Removing unnecessary `simp`s.
There is no `Ioi` in the statement
Yeah that was meant to refer to `{y ∈ s | x < y}`, but that's not really Ioi because of the `y ∈ s` condition.
You could write it as `s ∩ Ioi x`, I guess

That looks like a hole in our API. I tried golfing it but to no avail. Eg it would be a direct consequence of either a strengthening of `exists_Icc_mem_subset_of_mem_nhds` (that says `a ∈ Ioo b c` instead of `a ∈ Icc b c`) or of `exists_Ico_subset_of_mem_nhds` (that further says `u ∈ s`)
Would you mind doing these renames separately?. This PR is already pretty big.

```suggestion
theorem exists_gt_mem_of_mem_nhds [OrderTopology α] [NoMinOrder α] [DenselyOrdered α]
```
This should still be true. Actually even the following might be true but I am not sure how to prove it
```suggestion
theorem exists_gt_mem_of_mem_nhds [OrderTopology α] [DenselyOrdered α]
```
I removed one of the assumption. I don't think it's possible to remove the other (what if `a` is top?).
Can you make this a separate PR?
For 12 lines that you are already reviewing? I'm not sure I see the point.
To make sure the relevant reviewers see it, yes

```suggestion
lemma le_of_leftDeriv_nonpos_of_rightDeriv_nonneg (hf : ConvexOn ℝ S f) (hx : x ∈ interior S)
```
and below, no?
I rewrote the statements to use `IsMinOn` and I used that in the name.

```suggestion
  · exact (mem_diff _).mpr ⟨hys, fun h ↦ hyx.ne (mem_singleton_iff.mp h)⟩
  · exact (mem_diff _).mpr ⟨hz.1, fun h ↦ hz.2.ne' (mem_singleton_iff.mp h)⟩
```

```suggestion
  · exact (mem_diff _).mpr ⟨hz.1, fun h ↦ hz.2.ne (mem_singleton_iff.mp h)⟩
  · exact (mem_diff _).mpr ⟨hys, fun h ↦ hyx.ne' (mem_singleton_iff.mp h)⟩
```

```suggestion
  · exact le_of_eq (congrArg f h_eq)
```

~~In the course of this proof, you show `Ioo x b ⊆ {y | y ∈ S ∧ x < y}` three times: once on line 434, again on line 453 and once again on line 456. It seems sensible to me to extract that proof into a have statement inside this proof.~~ edit: might no longer apply.

```suggestion
lemma core {α β : Type*} [Preorder α] [ConditionallyCompleteLattice β] {f : α → β}
    {s t : Set α} (hst : s ⊆ t) (ht : BddBelow (f '' t)) (hf : MonotoneOn f t)
    (h : ∀ y ∈ t, ∃ x ∈ s, x ≤ y) :
    sInf (f '' s) = sInf (f '' t) := by
  obtain rfl | hs := Set.eq_empty_or_nonempty s
  · obtain rfl : t = ∅ := by simpa [Set.eq_empty_iff_forall_not_mem] using h
    rfl
  apply le_antisymm _ (csInf_le_csInf ht (hs.image _) (image_subset _ hst))
  refine le_csInf ((hs.mono hst).image f) ?_
  simp only [mem_image, forall_exists_index, and_imp, forall_apply_eq_imp_iff₂]
  intro a ha
  obtain ⟨x, hxs, hxa⟩ := h a ha
  exact csInf_le_of_le (ht.mono (image_subset _ hst)) ⟨x, hxs, rfl⟩ (hf (hst hxs) ha hxa)

lemma core' {α β : Type*} [Preorder α] [ConditionallyCompleteLattice β] {f : α → β}
    {s t : Set α} (hst : s ⊆ t) (ht : BddAbove (f '' t)) (hf : MonotoneOn f t)
    (h : ∀ y ∈ t, ∃ x ∈ s, y ≤ x) :
    sSup (f '' s) = sSup (f '' t) :=
  core (α := αᵒᵈ) (β := βᵒᵈ) hst ht hf.dual h

lemma hasDerivWithinAt_sInf_slope_of_mem_interior (hfc : ConvexOn ℝ S f) (hxs : x ∈ interior S) :
    HasDerivWithinAt f (sInf (slope f x '' {y ∈ S | x < y})) (Ioi x) x := by
  have hxs' := hxs
  rw [mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds, mem_nhds_iff_exists_Ioo_subset] at hxs'
  obtain ⟨a, b, hxab, habs⟩ := hxs'
  simp_rw [hasDerivWithinAt_iff_tendsto_slope]
  simp only [mem_Ioi, lt_self_iff_false, not_false_eq_true, diff_singleton_eq_self]
  have h : Ioo x b ⊆ {y | y ∈ S ∧ x < y} := fun z hz ↦ ⟨habs ⟨hxab.1.trans hz.1, hz.2⟩, hz.1⟩
  have h_Ioo : Tendsto (slope f x) (𝓝[>] x) (𝓝 (sInf (slope f x '' Ioo x b))) :=
    ((monotoneOn_slope_gt hfc (habs hxab)).mono h).tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioo_right
      (by simpa using hxab.2) ((bddBelow_slope_lt_of_mem_interior hfc hxs).mono (image_subset _ h))
  suffices sInf (slope f x '' Ioo x b) = sInf (slope f x '' {y ∈ S | x < y}) by rwa [← this]
  apply core h (bddBelow_slope_lt_of_mem_interior hfc hxs) (monotoneOn_slope_gt hfc (habs hxab)) ?_
  rintro y ⟨hyS, hxy⟩
  obtain ⟨z, hxz, hzy⟩ := exists_between (lt_min hxab.2 hxy)
  exact ⟨z, ⟨hxz, hzy.trans_le (min_le_left _ _)⟩, hzy.le.trans (min_le_right _ _)⟩

lemma hasDerivWithinAt_sSup_slope_of_mem_interior (hfc : ConvexOn ℝ S f) (hxs : x ∈ interior S) :
    HasDerivWithinAt f (sSup (slope f x '' {y ∈ S | y < x})) (Iio x) x := by
  have hxs' := hxs
  rw [mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds, mem_nhds_iff_exists_Ioo_subset] at hxs'
  obtain ⟨a, b, hxab, habs⟩ := hxs'
  simp_rw [hasDerivWithinAt_iff_tendsto_slope]
  simp only [mem_Iio, lt_self_iff_false, not_false_eq_true, diff_singleton_eq_self]
  have h : Ioo a x ⊆ {y | y ∈ S ∧ y < x} := fun z hz ↦ ⟨habs ⟨hz.1, hz.2.trans hxab.2⟩, hz.2⟩
  have h_Ioo : Tendsto (slope f x) (𝓝[<] x) (𝓝 (sSup (slope f x '' Ioo a x))) :=
    ((monotoneOn_slope_lt hfc (habs hxab)).mono h).tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioo_left
      (by simpa using hxab.1) ((bddAbove_slope_gt_of_mem_interior hfc hxs).mono (image_subset _ h))
  suffices sSup (slope f x '' Ioo a x) = sSup (slope f x '' {y ∈ S | y < x}) by rwa [← this]
  apply core' h (bddAbove_slope_gt_of_mem_interior hfc hxs) (monotoneOn_slope_lt hfc (habs hxab)) ?_
  rintro y ⟨hyS, hyx⟩
  obtain ⟨z, hyz, hzx⟩ := exists_between (max_lt hxab.1 hyx)
  exact ⟨z, ⟨(le_max_left _ _).trans_lt hyz, hzx⟩, (le_max_right _ _).trans hyz.le⟩
```

Looking at these lemmas, I realised they have a common `core` which is purely order-theoretic, and gives a result about how infima behave on images of cofinally above or cofinally below sets. And that one allows a) golfing and abstraction of the part of the proof after the suffices and b) order dualisation to help prove the second version. I think this gives you a nice golf and modularisation of the proofs, but it is up to you.
I have avoided giving the order-theory lemmas the correct names and locations since I would like to check with you first if you are okay with this refactoring of the proof!
Thanks for that refactor! I was sad that I had order dual proofs that were proved by copy-paste instead of anything more automatic. Your refactor improves that.
I renamed the two core theorems and moved them.

pullRequest.title: feat: left and right derivatives of a convex function

source.title: feat(InformationTheory): define the Kullback-Leibler divergence between two finite measures
